H0.text: An amino acid is what each codon stands for when groups of three bases form codons.

H1.text: Compound acid is what each codon, formed by groups of three bases, stands for.

H2.text: Minimal acid is what each codon stands for when groups of three bases form codons.

H3.text: Sulferic acid is what each codon stands for when groups of three bases form codons.

A4.text: The codons specify which amino acid will be added next during protein biosynthesis.

A5.text: translating single codons into single amino acids
